newsitem.title: USA: Hawkins in definitive pact to sell stake.
newsitem.headline: Hawkins in definitive pact to sell stake.

text.p: Hawkins Energy Co said on Monday it signed a definitive agreement under which a private investment group would acquire a large stake in the company.
The terms of the proposed transaction are the same as those in a previously agreed letter of intent.

Under the terms, Hawkins will issue eight milion shares of its common stock -- which would represent 38 percent of the then outstanding shares -- and warrants to buy an additional eight million shares, which on issuance would raise the group's stake to 55 percent, at an exercise price of $0.91 a share for a total payment of $4.4 million.
The payment includes a commitment by the group to try to provide certain business opportunities for the company.
The warrants would have a four year term, but would be exercisable only if the purchaser satisfies certain business development objectives called for in the agreement.

Completion of the proposed transaction requires certain conditions including approval by Hawkins shareholders of an increase in the company's authorized shares. The transaction is expected to close by December 15, 1996.

The group includes Ray Davis and Kelcy Warren, founders of Energy Transfer and officers of Cornerstone Natural Gas Inc based in Dallas, Texas. Cornerstone was acquired by El Paso Natural Gas Co in May, 1996.
